block.p: Dr. Kimberly Andrea Fulton and Christian Peter Michalik were married Friday at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Vincent Ferrer in New York. The Rev. John McGuire performed the ceremony.
The bride and the bridegroom, both 31, graduated from Yale, she magna cum laude and he cum laude.
Dr. Kimberly Andrea Fulton and Christian Peter Michalik were married Friday at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Vincent Ferrer in New York. The Rev. John McGuire performed the ceremony.
The bride and the bridegroom, both 31, graduated from Yale, she magna cum laude and he cum laude.

Dr. Fulton, who is keeping her name, received her medical degree from Tufts University and recently completed a residency in family medicine at the University of California at Los Angeles Medical Center. Next month, she will begin as a fellow in primary care sports medicine at the Cleveland Clinic. Her mother, Marilyn Fulton, lives in Kings Park, N.Y., and is the secretary to the director of marine resources at the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation in East Setauket.

Mr. Michalik is a partner in Soros Private Equity Partners, an investment group at Soros Fund Management Group in New York. His parents, Cecelia and Robert Michalik, live in Detroit. His mother was a secretary in the provost's office at Wayne State University in Detroit, and his father was that city's fire marshall.
